mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Benjamin Tallmadge, 1781 April 8
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: George Washington to Benjamin Tallmadge from his headquarters in New Windsor, 8 April 1781, in which he asks Tallmadge to transmit a letter to Rochambeau. Washington contemplated a daring raid on the British troop on Long Island. “The success of the Enterprise,” Washington wrote to Tallmadge, “must depend, on … the secrecy of the attempt, and a knowledge of the exact situation of the enemy.” Autograph letter in hand of Washington's aide-de-camp, signed by George Washington, 3 pages with integral address panel. Partial wax seal.
